author: Telegraph Staff
title: 15 things you didn't know about the world's greatest attractions
text:
MORE... 
Stonehenge 
100 years ago today, Stonehenge was sold at auction and bought by Cecil Chubb for £6,600. It has been suggested that he purchased it as a gift for his wife but she was didn’t like it, so he gave it to the nation three years later. Picture: GETTY
